node.title: Former Big Bash player used cricket to build trust with child grooming victims, court hears
node.alt: A sports headshot of a man in a purple uniform, smiling slightly.
node.description: Former professional cricketer Aaron Summers pleadsÂ guilty to possessing and sending child abuse material and grooming young boys using Snapchat and Instagram.
node.content:
["A former professional cricketer and one-time Big Bash League player has pleaded guilty to child grooming charges and possessing child abuse material.", "The\u00a0Northern Territory\u00a0Supreme Court\u00a0heard Aaron Summers, 25, used his position as a professional sportsperson to build trust with victims and solicit sexually explicit material from them through Snapchat and Instagram.\u00a0", "A fast bowler, Summers played professional cricket at a state level for Tasmania, in India and once for the Hobart Hurricanes in the Big Bash League.\u00a0", "He was the first Australian cricketer to play in a domestic cricket competition in Pakistan and played matches in Karachi and Abu Dhabi\u00a0earlier this year.\u00a0", "Crown prosecutor Hannah White described Summers's actions as \"predatory, callous and calculated\".\u00a0", "\"He engaged in sexualised conversations with them and requested them to send sexually explicit images of themselves.\"", "Summers pleaded\u00a0guilty to seven charges, including possessing and transmitting child abuse material and\u00a0transmitting communication with someone under 16 with the intention of procuring the recipient to engaging in or making\u00a0sexual activity.\u00a0", "The charges relate to multiple victims, including two young boys who were\u00a0aged 12 and 13 at the time of the offending .\u00a0", "The court heard all of the victims were personally known to Summers, through his involvement in cricket in Darwin.\u00a0", "
Victim's police officer mother 'devastated'
", "Two\u00a0victim impact statements were read to the court, including one from the\u00a0mother of a 13-year-old boy, who is herself\u00a0a senior police officer within the Northern Territory police.", "The woman labelled Summers a \"monster\" and described\u00a0the day she found out\u00a0about the offending as the \"worst day of her life\".", "", "
The court heard a statement from\u00a0one victim's\u00a0mother\u00a0who is a senior NT police officer.(ABC News: file photo)
", "\"Imagine being woken in the middle of the\u00a0night by the Northern Territory police, knocking on our door and informing us that a paedophile infiltrated our home and offended against our beautiful innocent 13-year-old son,\" the statement said.\u00a0", "\"To think that my specialty training was not enough to save my son from a monster like Aaron Summers is devastating.\"", "She said Summers\u00a0had taken away her son's innocence and should be ashamed.", "A second victim impact statement, from the mother of a\u00a013-year-old victim, described how her son\u00a0lost interest in schoolwork and become distant from family, friends and teachers following the offending.\u00a0", "Defence lawyer Matthew Hubber\u00a0told the court that Summers co-operated with investigators,\u00a0made full disclosures to police and had expressed remorse.\u00a0", "He requested that Summers's sentence be partially suspended and asked for him to be allowed to live with his parents, who were present in court, in Western Australia.\u00a0", "The matter was adjourned for a psychological report to be prepared before sentencing in December, with Summers remaining in custody."]
